column5: Ok I saw the trailers in the lot and some boats out by the mud line, lets here some reports, you didnt think I'd notice did you.....hmmmmmm
get out there & find out how it is for yourself
Was past there yesterday morning and noticed that there was still ice in the harbour, on the other side of the QEW, not on the lake side.

A few browns pulled today but very slow yet water temps 37.6 and lots of junk floating ...we picked up ran to the bar lots of laker being caught jiggen but none for us today trolling another week or so ...water was 33.3 off the bar ..

yes thats great news .  ...the fishing for the month of april is some of the best fishing all year,its not uncommon to get 25 fish in a weekend,we have had lots of fun down there at and around the welland canal and jordan harbour....i sure hope to be there in a few weeks....thanks for the report     cheers

FD see ya out there ill have the boat in the slip at weller  around the 4th or 5th ...last year on the 5th of April  we had 15 Kings by 11am ..hope this year is the same might be a little later with the cold Feb ..

We went out yesterday out of Port Dalhousie, fished from the canal down to the bar, 20ft-100ft.  Picked up four lakers near the canal on spoons but couldn't find anything else out there willing to hit.  Lakers have been hot though the past few weeks out in front of the canal, biggest one yesterday was 18lbs.  Some excellent fun to be had out there if you are just looking for some fun, some of the lakers put on a pretty good fight.  Can't wait till the salmon show up.  How deep do you normally have to go in April to hook up with the salmon?
17 to 40 fow ...all depends on water temps looks for the warmest water you can find ..40 deg and above is good water
Kool I will be out there when I get back from Florida april 3rd here is a pic from last year
